game_manager_for_gui module¶

class game_manager_for_gui.GameManagerForGUI(AI_strength)¶

Bases : object

A class used to manage the progress of a complete game in GUI mode. The GUI elements are not created and displayed here.

is_over¶
Type

a bool set to True when the game is finished (a player has no tiles anymore or no other tile can be played)

current_player¶
Type

an int set to 0 when the human plays and to 1 when the computer plays.

number_of_players¶
Type

an int constant equal to 2 (human vs computer)

players¶
Type

list of Player objects

board¶
Type

Board object containing the current state of the board

deck¶
Type

Deck object: the set of tiles used in the game

with_draw¶
Type

a bool constant set to False: play without draw.

check_game_over()¶

Checks if a game is over.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

A bool

first_player_to_play()¶

Determines the first player to play. In this version, the Human player always begins.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

Initialises the deck by adding tiles and shuffling it.

init_game(human_name)¶

Initializes the game (deck, players, board, which is first to play)

Renvoie

init_players(human_name)¶

Creates the 2 players (human and computer) and creates their hand, fills them with tiles.

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

play_ai_turn(tiles_ai_will_play)¶

Builds the set of tiles to play by AI and updates the game each time. The AI normally plays only once but can play multiple times if the human player has no possible move.

Paramètres

tiles_ai_will_play (a list of tiles to be played by AI (can be empty)) –

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

The list of played tiles (after possible recursive calls)

play_human_turn(tile, side)¶

Checks if the passed tile can be played on the passed side (using the RulesManager class). If this is the case, updates the game state.

Paramètres

  • tile (a Tile object, tile to play.) –

  • side (a str, the side on which the tile should be played.) –

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

A bool

player_who_has_tile_in_hand(tile)¶

Finds if a player has a particular Tile (passed as paramater) :param tile: :type tile: a Tile objects which is equal (==) to the seeked tile

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

A Player object (from the players list) if one of the players has the tile passed as parameter in hand, None otherwise.

scores_of_players()¶

Computes the scores of the players and sort the tuples (name, score) by ascending order of score

Renvoie

list_of_scores

Type renvoyé

the sorted list of tuples (name, score)

suggest_move_for_human(hand)¶
undo_move()¶

Undoes a complete turn (human and AI moves). The successive moves are stored in a stack. Places the tiles back into the players” hands. :param None:

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None

update_game_state(tile, side, player)¶

Update the state of the game by placing the played tile on the board and removing it from the player’s hand, checking if the game is over.

Paramètres

  • tile (the Tile object to be played) –

  • side (a string "left" or "right") –

  • player (a Player object: the player who plays.) –

Renvoie

Type renvoyé

None
